title: TAGL Instructional Design Workshop for Applying Cognitive Load Theory in Chemistry Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemistry concepts and secondary education experience
context.additional_context: A professional development process for in-service secondary school teachers to learn how to apply the TAGL approach in chemistry classes within a smartphone-based environment, with project-based assessments evaluating actual lesson design competencies.

learning_goals: Can explain the three types of cognitive load theory (intrinsic, extraneous, germane) and suggest application methods in chemistry lesson design
Can design chemistry experiment processes utilizing the four stages of TAGL instructional method (prior knowledge activation-concept visualization-gradual problem solving-feedback cycle)
Can select digital tools (quiz apps, collaboration platforms) usable in limited technology environments (smartphones) to create chemistry concept learning materials
Can analyze cognitive load factors students experience during chemistry problem-solving and establish instructional strategies to reduce them

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
